assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement: DCAT-AP is included only in the national catalogue of Belgium and its NIF is not aligned with 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
DCAT-AP is an RDF vocabulary for representing data catalogues that allows data owners to provide metadata about the datasets they publish. By describing catalogues, datasets and resources, a publisher makes them easily searchable and discoverable.

In fact, DCAT-AP is used for the publication of datasets in linked open data portals at a National (e.g. ) and European scale ( European Data Portal)

See:                                                                                                                                       https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases

P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specificationÂ
statement:
SEMIC,  the Semantic Interoperability Community, who is in charge of developing DCAT-AP has a specific Change and Release Management Policy for DCAT-AP where they encourages any stakeholder to contribute to the development of the specification.

See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/document/change-and-release-management-policy-dcat-ap 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/about
https://github.com/SEMICeu/DCAT-AP

A public review is part of the decision-making process defined by the change and release management policy.

Europe/document/change-and-release-management-policy-dcat-ap

https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is sufficiently mature and has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
DCAT-AP has a significant market acceptance. It has been successfully implemented by several European Union Institution:
â¢ The European Commission DG CONNECT with the European Data Portal
â¢ The Publications Office of the European Union with the European Union Open Data Portal
â¢ The European Commission DG JRC with the JRC Data Catalogue
 and National Public administrations across Europe:
â¢ The German GovData Business Office with the German Data Portal
â¢ The Belgian Federal Public Service for ICT with the Belgian open data portal
â¢ The Dutch Ministry of Interior and Kingdom Relations with the Dutch open data portal
â¢ The Open Data Portal of Switzerland with the Geocat CKAN Harvester
â¢ The Spanish Open Data Portal
â¢ The Swedish innovation agency VINNOVA and the Swedish national data portal
â¢ Swedish MetaSolutions and the EntryScape Catalogue

See complete list of users/implementations:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/about

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
At the moment of performing this assessment, Linked Open Data portals are innovative solutions adopted by public administrations all around Europe. DCAT-AP fosters the implementation of Five-Star Linked Open Data by allowing users to discover interlinked information from other portals. 

See:
https://www.ontotext.com/knowledgehub/fundamentals/five-star-linked-open-data/
https://www.europeandataportal.eu/en
http://data.europa.eu/euodp/en/home
http://data.jrc.ec.europa.eu/

P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
DCAT-AP has a strong support from different communities. In fact, it is a joint initiative of:
â¢ The DCAT-AP Working Group; the Directorate-General for Informatics: DG â¢ DIGIT - in particular the SEMIC action of the ISAÂ² programme;
the Directorate-General for Communications Networks, Content & â¢ Technology: DG CONNECT; and
â¢ The Publications Office of the EU.

See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/about  
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/sites/isa/files/leaflet_dcat-ap_lr_v13.pdf

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of administrative rules, processes, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement: By allowing the exchange of datasets metadata, DCAT-AP increases the searchability, visibility, discoverability and reuse of existing data, including information on processes and administrative rules.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification helps ensuring the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement:
DCAT-AP does no directly help for the provision of application programming interfaces (APIs) or Web services.

However, DCAT-AP aims to ensure consistency by providing a standard description of the catalogues and datasets published by data portals across Europe. This description makes datasets more searchable and accessible for data reusers and encourages the data providers to use open data portals for dissemination of reusable data.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.Â
statement:
DCAT is a domain-agnostic specification that can be reused for the description of any catalogue of dataset independently from the business domain addressed.

For DCAT users having business-specific requirements, the specification is generally extended (e.g. StatDCAT-AP for statistical data)

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
statement:
DCAT-AP is available for its implementation and use on Github and Joinup, the European Commission collaborative platform for the reuse of IT Solutions.

See: 

https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/about  
https://github.com/SEMICeu/DCAT-AP

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is independent from any specific technology and/or platform.
statement: As most of the vocabularies, DCAT reuses several existing ones (e.g. "adms", "foaf", DCAT) and the Resource Description Framework (RDF). This  results in a dependency that can hamper interoperability, especially in the case where new releases of the reused vocabularies are not backward compatible.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
DCAT-AP, as a data vocabulary, can be used for large amounts of data and does not hamper the scalability of systems using it. It is evidenced by the several implementations at the national or European level.

See: 
https://www.w3.org/2011/gld/wiki/DCAT_Implementations

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The purpose of DCAT-AP it to support the evolution of European Public Services by enhancing the searchability and discoverability of datasets across borders. DCAT-AP is an interoperability enabler.
 
See:                                                                                                                                       
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/dcat-ap-key-european-data-publishers-reach-data-consumers-and-create-european-open-data-ecosystem_en

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
DCAT-AP, as a cross-border and cross-sector vocabulary increases government-to-government reuse of data and therefore can prevent citizens or businesses from providing standard information several times. Like all common vocabularies, DCAT-AP facilitates the implementation of the once-only principle. 

See:
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/dcat-ap-key-european-data-publishers-reach-data-consumers-and-create-european-open-data-ecosystem_en

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement: The purpose of DCAT-AP is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
The DCAT-AP vocabulary supports the attribution of data and metadata to various participants such as resource creators, publishers and other parties.

In addition, it also supports the association of rights and licenses with catalogued Resources and Distributions.

Such metadata improves the reliability of data exchanged between citizens, businesses and public administrations.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement: The purpose of DCAT-AP is not related to the multilingual delivery of European public services. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The adoption of the standard or specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement: DCAT-AP allows the exchange of metadata across borders which, in some cases can reduces administrative burden.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
As an extension of DCAT, DCAT-AP by allowing the description of catalogues and datasets, aggregated DCAT-AP metadata can serve as a manifest file as part of the digital preservation process. 

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-2/

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the standard or specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are several reports assessing how DCAT-AP is effective and efficient for the publication of open data. 

See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/dcat-ap

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification can be mapped to the EIRA.
statement:
DCAT-AP is already associated to  EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, DCAT can define the interoperability aspects of the "Data Publication Component" and "Data Publication Service" ABBs of the EIRA Semantic View.

See:                                                                                                                                       https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/sites/default/files/distribution/access_url/2019-03/76cb237b-0de8-464c-84ca-1327945eac3e/EIRA_v3_0_0_Overview.pdf

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the standard or specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
SEMIC developed a service that checks the integrity and consistency against the DCAT-AP specification of one or more software description metadata files. It is available for free at the on Joinup, the European Commission collaborative platform for the reuse of IT Solutions.

See: 
http://dcat-ap.semic.eu/dcat-ap_validator.html 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/about

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is recommended by a EU Member State.
statement:
DCAT-AP is recommended by Italy, The Netherlands, Sweden, Belgium, and Spain. These Member States extended DCAT-AP to meet the specific national needs.

See: 
https://datos.gob.es/sites/default/files/doc/file/report_dcat- 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been selected for its use in a EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
DCAT-AP has been selected for the description of datasets by three European Initiatives  The European Data Portal, The European Open Data Portal and the JRC Data Catalogue. 

See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/about

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
DCAT-AP is part of the Belgian catalogue of recommended specifications.

See:
https://www.belgif.be/nl/specifications

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
As a solution developed by the  SEMIC action of the ISA2 Programme funded by the European Commission, DCAT-AP is part of their supra-national catalogue of reusable solutions.

See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/our-solutions
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/solutions_en

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidence has been found of the specification being included in an interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement: After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the Multi-stakeholder-platform (MSP), no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling standard or specification.
statement: The purpose of DCAT-AP is not related to the medullisation of business processes. Therefore this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement: The purpose of DCAT-AP is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
DCAT-AP is a cross-sector and cross-border reusable vocabulary.

In contexts where there are sector-specific or national requirements, the specification is extended (e.g. DCAT-AP-BE, DCAT-AP, StatDCAT-AP)

assessment_title: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement: DCAT-AP has been developed to facilitate the publication of linked open data.

P1: Data Catalog Vocabulary - Application Profile for European Data Portals (DCAT-AP 2.0)
criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
DCAT-AP is available on Joinup, the collaborative platform created by the European Commission to share and reuse IT solutions and good practices.

See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases
